thread.title: Stratasys Warns, Pulls Guidance For 3D Printer Maker
thread.title_full: Stratasys Warns, Pulls Guidance For 3D Printer Maker

title: Stratasys Warns, Pulls Guidance For 3D Printer Maker
text:
GDP, Jobs Data Dent Stock Futures; Facebook, Skechers, Qorvo In Motion 
Stock futures shifted out of tightly mixed trade to firm losses Thursday after GDP and jobs data fell short of consensus projections. Dow futures slumped 27.4 points below fair market value. S&P 500 futures were down 6.3 points. Nasdaq 100 futures dragged 12.6 below fair market value. Small ... 09:10 AM ET Stratasys Earnings: 'Turnaround' For 3D Printer Maker? 
Beleaguered 3D printer maker Stratasys (NASDAQ:SSYS) is expected to report a sharp slowdown in sales with second-quarter earnings Thursday. The consensus estimate is for revenue of $182.3 million, up 2% from the same quarter a year ago but a sharp deceleration from a healthy string of double-digit ... 07/29/2015 08:02 AM ET Ambarella Stock Plummets On Short-Seller's Report 
Highflying chip stock Ambarella (NASDAQ:AMBA) was winged by a negative report from short-seller Citron Research on Friday, falling hard for the second straight trading day on Monday. Ambarella, maker of video processing chips for GoPro (NASDAQ:GPRO) and others, saw its shares plummet 19%, near 96, ... 06/22/2015 01:18 PM ET Paris Air Show: Fewer Sales? 
3 Boeing (NYSE:BA) and Airbus (OTCPK:EADSY) may land fewer orders than average from the iconic Paris Air Show due to record backlogs and saturated growth markets. Lockheed Martin (NYSE:LMT) won't be flying its F-35. So emerging manufacturing techs like Stratasys' (NASDAQ:SSYS) 3-D printing are ... 06/10/2015 06:51 PM ET Will 3D Printers, Robots Be New Paris Air Show Stars? 
Lower-than-average Boeing (NYSE:BA) and Airbus (OTCPK:EADSY) orders are expected at the Paris Air Show next week due to record backlogs and saturated growth markets, giving manufacturing technologies like 3D printing a chance to shine. Stratasys (NASDAQ:SSYS), a maker of 3D printers, will be at the ... 06/10/2015 05:08 PM ET MedAssets Beats Low Expectations, Stock Gaps Up 
Health care software maker MedAssets (NASDAQ:MDAS) beat what an analyst called low expectations; its outlook also exceeded Wall Street views, sending the stock gapping up to a 12-month high. MedAssets stock was up 8.5% in midday trading in the stock market today, above 23. Earlier, shares rose as ... 12:10 PM ET Ruckus Stock Roars On School Wi-Fi, Cable TV 
Ruckus Wireless (NYSE:RKUS) stock roared back Thursday on better-than-expected Q2 revenue, as analysts said a rebound might be underway at the maker of Wi-Fi networking gear. Sunnyvale, Calif.-based Ruckus late Wednesday reported in-line EPS. Ruckus stock soared 16% in morning trading in the stock ... 11:19 AM ET T-Mobile Q2 Sales Growth Tops Rivals; More M&A Clout? 
T-Mobile US (NYSE:TMUS) outpaced bigger rivals AT&T (NYSE:T)and Verizon Communications (NYSE:VZ) by posting Q2 revenue growth of 14% early Thursday, topping Wall Street views amid signs that T-Mobile's falling revenue per subscriber might have bottomed despite an industry price war. Analysts ... 09:39 AM ET 
Shares of Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) chip supplier Qorvo (NASDAQ:QRVO) tumbled in after-hours trade Wednesday as the company's second-quarter guidance fell short of expectations. Qorvo, which was formed earlier this year in the $1.6 billion RF Micro Devices-TriQuint Semiconductor merger, earned an ... 07/29/2015 08:47 PM ET SolarCity Revenue Growth Surges, But So Do Its Losses 
SolarCity (NASDAQ:SCTY) late Wednesday posted a bigger loss than analysts expected, but revenue soared 67%, above Wall Street expectations. SolarCity stock was down 1% in after-hours trading, after the No. 1 residential solar installer posted its Q2 earnings. The company reported a per-share loss ... 07/29/2015 07:11 PM ET
